fields.description:
As of now, users can only GET and PUT(add) Pipelines SSH key through API.\\
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pipelines_config/ssh/key_pair

Since Pipelines has the functionality to allow users to generate SSH key through UI, it will be best to also include the ability for users to generate Pipelines SSH key using API.
fields.summary: Generate Pipelines SSH key using API

I´ve tried to load with firebug window closed, no luck.

‌

Thanks
fields.summary: Pipelines / Deployments not showing up in dashboard

fields.description:
Hi,

In one of my Bitbucket pipeline step I download few dependencies from Azure Blob Storage. It is one zip file of size ~540MB(s). Till yesterday it was working fine and from today I am getting Access denied to local path issue (Path inside Bitbucket pipeline run time)

* Pipe I am using to download dependencies is *microsoft/azure-storage-deploy:1.1.1*
* Error I am getting is

** [2019/06/18 15:05:28.614+00:00][VERBOSE] Transfer FAILED: https://xyz.blob.core.windows.net/builds/ReleaseDependencies/dependencies.zip => /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/dependencies.zip.\\
[2019/06/18 15:05:28][ERROR] Single file transfer failed: _Failed to open file /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/dependencies.zip: Access to the path '''/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/dependencies.zip''' is denied_.. _Access to the path '''/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/dependencies.zip''' is denied._
* Till yesterday same pipeline was working fine and today it starting giving the above issue. It looks like it is coming from run time of pipeline

‌

Any help in this regard is highly appreciated.
fields.summary: Access denied to a local path

fields.description:
We just encountered a weird error in the Commits view. When develop branch is selected, Bitbucket claims that there are no commits to display.

‌

When selecting “Show all” There are only some old commits visible from November 2018.

I cloned the repo for testing purposes and it seems that the branches actually are OK and all the commits are there. So, the problem may be in Bitbucket.

‌

Tested with two users, Chrome, Firefox and Edge.

!1335069262-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Commits are missing from branch commits view

fields.description:
The updated pull request list (paginated vs the old indefinite scroll) introduced some poor behaviour when filtering by target branch - it performs a substring match rather than an exact match (so attempting to filter to all PRs going to {{master}} will also include everything going to {{[all-feature-branches]/master}} etc) - this is a whole lot of needless clutter when you are trying to work on a specific subset of PRs.

Since, as far as I can see, the only way of filtering via the UI is to actually select a branch (you can't just type the prefix and let it filter), it doesn't seem too ridiculous that anyone wanting to do URL hacks to limit the list to some prefix could use the same {{~}} means a “contains match” that is used for the API (see [https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/meta/filtering|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/meta/filtering]) and let the standard behaviour of “select a branch as the target branch” actually *work* to filter down to that destination branch
fields.summary: Branch filtering is too fuzzy on the pull request list

fields.description:
On wide monitors it’s not very comfortable to work with the Bitbucket. Control buttons like “Create issue” and “Cancel” are at the right side of the screen while the main form is on the left. The same with the Issues page: issues titles are at the left while other important columns are too far on the right.

It would be nice to have an option to change fluid width to fixed.
fields.summary: Fixed page width

fields.description:
With builds running on multiple branches, it's hard for users to navigate and search for build under a specific branch.

h2. Suggestion
It will best to have the ability for users to filter builds by entering a search string to search for a specific branch
fields.summary: Support search in branches filter

fields.description: This could be useful for the user to check if all their testing is running or not as some cases the test didn't start and was skipped.

fields.description:
The behavior that we currently have for invitations is that when you add a user to your repository or group, it sends an invitation to that user first.

This feature request is to add the ability to opt out of this invitation and allow users to add other users to repositories or groups without sending an e-mail invitation.
fields.summary: Do not send e-mail invitations for repository invitations

fields.description:
Hi,

I have this excerpt of code in the Bitbucket pipelines
{code:java}
branches:
    master:
      - step:
          name: Move code to Databricks
          deployment: production
          caches:
            - pip
          script:
            - pip install -r requirements.txt
            - bash move_code_to_databricks.sh prod
      - step:
          name: Update the job in Databricks
          deployment: production
          script:
            - python configure_job_in_databricks.py prod
{code}
‌

I tested it in the validator and it passes , but the build fails saying that
{quote}The deployment environment 'production' in your bitbucket-pipelines.yml file occurs multiple times in the pipeline
{quote}
----
*New Update:*

Reopened the bug ticket as pipeline validator still fails to identify error if multiple steps deploying to the same environment with more than one blocks, for example:
{code:java}
image: atlassian/default-image:2
pipelines:
  default:
     - parallel:
         - step:
              name: Build and Test
              script:
                   - echo "test"
                   
         - step:
               name: Prod
               script:
                    - echo "test"
          
                  
  branches:
      master:
          - step:
               name: Build and Test
               script:
                   - echo "test"
          - step:
               name: Deploy to Production numbered
               deployment: Production
               script:
                    - echo "test"
                    
          - step:
              name: Deploy to Production latest
              deployment: Production
              script:
                  - echo "test"
                 
                   {code}
fields.summary: Pipelines validator allows multiple steps deploying to same environment

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When creating a new branch permission, the options 'Allow rewriting branch history' and 'Allow deleting this branch' are initially missing: !1688760315-Screen%20Shot%202019-06-17%20at%2018.38.01.png|thumbnail!

Those options only show up once the user fills in the *Write access* field: !978177355-Screen%20Shot%202019-06-17%20at%2018.38.09.png|thumbnail!

This can be confusing for users, who might think that these options have been removed or are no longer available.

h3. Suggested Solution
Always show those options, without requiring that *Write access* or any other field is filled in first.
fields.summary: Always show the options 'Allow rewriting branch history' and 'Allow deleting this branch' options in Branch permission

fields.description:
User no longer see the page confirming a successful branch merger.

# Got to Branches > Select a Branch by clicking on Branch name.
# Select a Branch to merge to. > Press “Merge”.
# “Merge Changes” box - Click on “Merge”. “Nothing” appears to happen.
# Go back to main Branch page. Notice recent changes to the destination branch from your merge.

!238433952-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Branch merge - confirmation of successful merging does not appear

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to do any setup to services in Bitbucket Pipelines. However, it would be nice to be able to add seed data or run other kinds of commands before using the service in the main step script.

For example:

{{image: dotnet}}\\
{{pipelines:}}\\
{{default:}}\\
{{- step:}}\\
{{services:}}\\
{{- database}}\\
{{script:}}\\
{{- dotnet restore}}\\
{{- dotnet build}}

{{definitions:}}\\
{{services:}}\\
{{database:}}\\
{{image: mongo}}\\
{{<it would be really nice if I could add setup steps here>}}
fields.summary: Ability to run script commands against services in Bitbucket Pipelines

fields.description:
This feature request is for having the Bitbucket Pipelines "Pipes" feature, by default, copy to its container all environment variables that are present on the build container, if not defined in the Pipes definition.

This will prevent huge Pipes options definitions inside the Pipelines yml, as Pipes will already fetch all necessary variables for it to run.
fields.summary: Automatically parse all created environment variables to Pipes
Our pipelines are no longer able to create directories in `/source` during runtime

fields.description:
!1412353983-image.png|thumbnail!

{code}
Time: 1.03 minutes, Memory: 36.00 MB

OK (53 tests, 86 assertions)
{code}

‌

Exit code 0 is expected so build will be passed, but i get 139 status.

Dockerfile based on {{php:7.1-fpm}}

‌

Here is my phpunit.xml

{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<phpunit backupGlobals="false"
         backupStaticAttributes="false"
         bootstrap="vendor/autoload.php"
         colors="true"
         convertErrorsToExceptions="true"
         convertNoticesToExceptions="true"
         convertWarningsToExceptions="true"
         processIsolation="false"
         stopOnFailure="false">
    <testsuites>
        <testsuite name="Unit">
            <directory suffix="Test.php">./tests/Unit</directory>
        </testsuite>

        <testsuite name="Feature">
            <directory suffix="Test.php">./tests/Feature</directory>
        </testsuite>
    </testsuites>
    <filter>
        <whitelist processUncoveredFilesFromWhitelist="true">
            <directory suffix=".php">./app</directory>
        </whitelist>
    </filter>
    <php>
        <server name="APP_ENV" value="testing"/>
        <server name="BCRYPT_ROUNDS" value="4"/>
        <server name="CACHE_DRIVER" value="array"/>
        <server name="MAIL_DRIVER" value="array"/>
        <server name="QUEUE_CONNECTION" value="sync"/>
        <server name="SESSION_DRIVER" value="array"/>
        <env name="DB_CONNECTION" value="sqlite_memory"/>
    </php>
</phpunit>
{code}
fields.summary: Pipelines build failed even if Phpunit tests passed
UN EXPECTED ERROR SHOWN WHEN SYNCING REPOS

fields.description:
GitHub released a feature in beta that allows you to jump to a function or method’s definition within the same public repository by clicking the function or method call in a file. Would be great to see this in Bitbucket.

[https://help.github.com/en/articles/navigating-code-on-github|https://help.github.com/en/articles/navigating-code-on-github]

[[https://github.blog/changelog/2019-06-11-jump-to-definition-in-public-repositories/|https://github.blog/changelog/2019-06-11-jump-to-definition-in-public-repositories/]](https://github.blog/changelog/2019-06-11-jump-to-definition-in-public-repositories)
fields.summary: Jump to Definition

fields.description:
There are two scenario where, while using screen reader, we are not able to interact with Bitbucket properly:

Scenario 1:

1. Create a new pull request.\\
2. Move to the edit field to add reviewers.\\
3. Start typing the first few letters of the name of a reviewer.\\
4. The list of possible matches is not accessible by arrowing up and down using a screen reader.\\
5. You need to enter the complete name of the reviewer and then hit enter to get the correct reviewer added.

Scenario 2:

1. Go to an existing pull request\\
2. Click on ‘More’ and and then ‘Edit’ in order to edit the pull request.\\
3. There is no way of adding additional reviewers using a screen reader.\\
There is an edit field but typing the name of a reviewer in the field has no affect.\\
4. The link for deleting a reviewer is not properly labelled. The link just appears as the ‘#’ character when read with a screen reader.

Test environment:

Latest Chrome and Firefox browsers\\
Windows 10\\
Jaws 2019 screen reader
fields.summary: Improve Bitbucket UI to work with screen reader(BBS-108796)

fields.description:
While we are able to use API to pull a PR and retrieved the uploaded image URLs within, we are unable to retrieve the images directly using App Password or OAuth authentication.

Trying to retrieve the Pull Request images via App Password or OAuth authentication directly will return: “403: This endpoint does not support token-based authentication”

If we try to access the image URL directly that was returned from the PR API, we will get redirected with a Status Code: 302 and the required credential type is "Session".
fields.summary: Allow Pull Request images to be retrievable via App Password or OAuth authentication

Example:

fields.description:
Sometimes I have to Approve or Merge several open pull requests. I have to open each one by one and Approve them and/or Merge them into target branch.

Would be very convenient if I can do it in one batch right from /pull-requests/ page.

Of course I need to have a way how to *select only those* which are supposed to be Approved and/or Merged.
fields.summary: Batch update of Pull Requests

According to our IT Technician, there isn’t even any log of an email sending to (redacted), meaning it didn’t even hit our mail servers. This to him meant it my be a fault on your end, so just checking to see if there’s any log your side of the emails? Or if there’s a known issue..?

Thanks,

fields.description: When creating a new branch restriction, users can only be specified by {{uuid}}. All other fields – notably {{account_id}} – are ignored.
fields.summary: account_id ignored in favor of UUID when creating branch restriction

fields.description:
You can see it in this issue:

[https://bitbucket.org/StoneStepsInc/stonestepswebalizer/issues/16#comment-52225983|https://bitbucket.org/StoneStepsInc/stonestepswebalizer/issues/16#comment-52225983]

This comment was added by the issue reporter (KS in this thread), but is attributed to the repository owner.

The list of allowed actions for this comment includes editing, which suggests that the bug goes deeper than just a name mix-up and actually switches the user behind the scenes, which is unrecoverable loss of information.

It appears to relate to assigning issue to the user that becomes the comment author. Here’s another example:

[https://bitbucket.org/StoneStepsInc/stonestepswebalizer/issues/10/webalizer-win64-4-2-2-3-freeze-sometime#comment-52226087|https://bitbucket.org/StoneStepsInc/stonestepswebalizer/issues/10/webalizer-win64-4-2-2-3-freeze-sometime#comment-52226087]

The comment was added by the issue reporter, but it is also attributed to the repository owner.

Can somebody please look into this? I hope you can  recover original comment authors, as it is quite hard to follow who commented what now.
fields.summary: Original comment author is replaced with another user in some issues

fields.description:
Dear Engineers,

Can we change the behavior of our README files, that if someone uploads a README file without extension, we would treat it as a text file and we wouldn’t enforce any formatting/rendering on it once we open it in the Source editor?
fields.summary: Treat README file without extension as a text file

fields.description:
When you embed an image within an Issue, (e.g. on bitbucket.org/username/project_name/issues/31), the responsive design automatically resizes it to fit within the web-page width.

If I want to view the full-size image, I have to right-click and choose “View Image” which then opens the original image (stored on bitbucket-assetroot.s3.amazonaws.com/repository).

It would nice if the embedded image was automatically hyperlinked to open the full-size version.
fields.summary: Link to view full-size image embedded within an Issue

fields.summary: Pipelines validator doesn't validate YAML anchors

fields.summary: In commits page, commit message is rendering in large fonts

fields.description: I see the error code 500 when I click on the “Webhooks / Jenkins request logs” tab, even though if I send the same request manually, I get the code 200. Nothing in our Jenkins configuration changed (resend request does not help, the situation applies to all our bitbucket repositories).
fields.summary: Error code 500 on webhook trigger Jenkins job

fields.description:
*Why*: Because it often results in misunderstandings and necessary additional communication if the comment isn’t related to a specific code line or part of a line. You either can quote the related code in your comment (additional time to review) or you get questions from the one processing your comments (additional time until a commit is ready to merge). Additionally, you can’t have multiple comments to one code line yet.

*How to solve*: I suggest to enable the reviewer to mark a code snippet and have a tooltip (like in Confluence) to write his comment related to the marked code. Also the code snippet marked should be highlighted (as in Confluence).
fields.summary: Highlight code a comment refers to

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Enabling "Commit list as a single page app" beta feature caused the commit tab to change any commit title with # in the start to change into a markdown header

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to account labs
# Enable "Commit list as a single page app"
# Create a new commit and add # in front of the commit title
# Open Commit page the character will be enlarged with markdown header.

h3. Expected Results
The title should not be changed into markdown header

h3. Actual Results
The title with # in front change into markdown header

h3. Workaround
Disable the beta feature "Commit list as a single page app"
fields.summary: Enabling "Commit list as a single page app" beta feature caused the commit tab to change any commit title with # in the start to change into a markdown header

fields.description: Find and add a reviewer to a PR  on public repo is nearly to impossible because there are so many people with the same name and there is no way to know who is who. Showing an people email would be very helpful.
fields.summary: Show email of a reviewer on a "add reviewers" popup window

fields.description: A small QoL update would be to focus the Title field when creating an Issue because now the focus is getting switched to the description field which isn't even required.
fields.summary: When creating an issue, focus the title field (required) instead of the description (not required)

fields.description: This seems backwards, and ignores restrictions an who was originally listed as approvers.

fields.description:
As per the title, this feature request is for adding a branch permission rule to only allow merging in the specified branch if the branch that is merging into it matches a naming pattern, for example, only allow merging into master if my branch is named "develop" or "feature/*".

This will help prevent unwanted merges into branches.
fields.summary: Add branch restriction to only allow merging on a specific branch if the the branch name matches a pattern

fields.description:
This is very intermittent, but sometimes the default branch for pull requests is not the main branch.

The expected behavior is that every time you attempt to open a pull request, the default selected branch is the branch you are working on -> main branch.
fields.summary: Default branch for pull requests is intermittently not the main branch

fields.description: On the Commits page, the graph to the left of the commits will run out of sync when displaying along multiline commit messages, or commit messages which are too long and take up 2 lines.
fields.summary: Commit graph does not handle multiline commit messages

fields.description: when a PR is generated some special keywords such as “debugger” and/or “console.log()” should be highlighted with a different color so that the reviewer can easily spot them.
fields.summary: optimization of a Pull request

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clicking on team account repositories setting excluded file setting labs will redirect the user to team account lab setting and not personal account lab settings.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Team account
# Select repositories
# Go to repositories setting > excluded file
# Click at "Bitbucket Labs" at "You can enable the new experience in Bitbucket Labs"
# It will redirect to team account labs

h3. Expected Results
Redirect to Personal account labs

h3. Actual Results
Redirect to Team account labs

h3. Workaround
Click on bottom left side > Labs to access your personal labs setting
fields.summary: Excluded files labs warning message redirecting user to team account labs instead of user account labs

fields.description:
Hi all,

When I create a release branch from the [bitbucket.org|http://bitbucket.org] branches page, the release pipeline is triggered.

!916934116-image.png|thumbnail!\\
‌

But when I create a release branch from JIRA, it won’t trigger the release pipeline.

[https://bitbucket.org/branch/create?issueKey=WCWT-3&issueType=Epic&issueSummary=Theme+Modification+fixes+on+CI%2FCD+Walkthrough|https://bitbucket.org/branch/create%3FissueKey%3DWCWT-3%26amp%3BissueType%3DEpic%26amp%3BissueSummary%3DTheme%2BModification%2Bfixes%2Bon%2BCI%252FCD%2BWalkthrough]

!2322008911-image.png|thumbnail!

My partial pipeline configuration

{code}
pipelines:
  branches:
    develop:
      - step: *buildimage
      - step: *deploytest

    master:
      - step: *buildimage
      - step: *katalontests
      - step: *deployproduction

    release/*:
      - step: *buildimage
      - step: *deploystaging

    hotfix/*:
      - step: *buildimage
      - step: *deploystaging

  pull-requests:
   release/*:
     - step: *katalontests

   hotfix/*:
     - step: *katalontests
{code}
fields.summary: Pipelines doesn't trigger if release branch is created from JIRA

fields.description: Currently, when running a custom pipeline against a branch, there is no variable (that I am aware of) containing the branch name. When doing this by going to *Branches > Builds > Run pipeline for a branch* it would be nice to have the branch name accessible as a variable in bitbucket-pipelines.yml
fields.summary: Add branch variable when running custom pipeline against branch
Logs showing variable names in place of text output

fields.description: It would be good to have a page to check API usage against our rate limits, as it would assist in determining exactly which portions of a workflow are topping the rate limits.
fields.summary: Include rate limits usage on Bitbucket Settings

fields.description: We activated pipelines on a project, and regardless of the content the message displayed is an error message.
fields.summary: Error modifying pipelines configuration file

fields.description:
There is a issue while taking clone using jenkins while when i searching jenkinsfile listing is working but while clone or fetch ot is showing error 403.

‌

We have another jenkins there everything is working fine with same user credential.
fields.summary: No able to take clone using jenkins

fields.description:
As per the title, this issue requests the addition of an endpoint that allows users to change the default pull request description via api.

https://bitbucket.org/<USERNAME>/<REPO_SLUG>/admin/pullrequests/default-pull-request-description/
fields.summary: Default description API

fields.description:
Since Bitbucket pipelines provided documents and sample for other languages, got interested in doing the same for a Flutter repository. During a quick R&D, could find any reference within Bitbucket/Atlassian and only found from different providers.

Expecting it to run using Bitbucket pipelines, do we have any documentation (draft or published) can we enable with a Flutter repository.
fields.summary: Pipeline support for Flutter repository
Bug: JS error  when trying to Deploy

fields.description:
h3. Problem
The Bitbucket bitbucket-pipelines.yml validator is not properly validating a command if it starts with the bash test  command ”[[ expression ]]”.

!804796871-Screen%20Shot%202019-06-07%20at%2016.28.19.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to reproduce
Create a a pipeline with a test like shown in the image above

h3. Workaround
Wrap up the test command with an *IF* command like described below.

The command:

{{[ $BITBUCKET_BRANCH =~ [A-Z][a-z]+-[0-9]{2,} ] && export BRANCH = $BASH_REMATCH[0]}}

Will become:

{{if [ $BITBUCKET_BRANCH =~ [A-Z][a-z]+-[0-9]{2,} ]; then export BRANCH = $BASH_REMATCH[0]; fi}}
fields.summary: bitbucket-pipelines.yml validator should correctly handle the bash test command

fields.description:
Applies to the new custom deployment environments feature recently added to BB pipelines.

I deleted an environment and after it was done it switched all the lock icons to unlock icons for the other environments. Refreshing the browser fixed the problem. This was in Safari.

See attached video for demonstration.
fields.summary: New deployments feature shows unlock icon for all environments after deleting one

fields.description:
Currently the author filter for the repository list on the Bitbucket dashboard shows all users available in Bitbucket cloud.\\
This makes Bitbucket take about 10-15 seconds to look for any repositories.

The suggestion here would be to only be able to search for repositories that the user currently owns or has access to.
fields.summary: Author filter looks for all users on Bitbucket

fields.description: [https://bitbucket.org/{acc68cbe-a2ed-4450-a3ed-c37758693f00}/|https://bitbucket.org/%257Bacc68cbe-a2ed-4450-a3ed-c37758693f00%257D/] shows a error page, but the project is listed in my projects page.

fields.description:
I am receiving this error when trying to deploy to Azure production:

_The environment 'production' in your bitbucket-pipelines.yml doesn’t match any environment defined in your settings. Either update your yml, or your settings, to use the same name._

I don’t understand what is wrong with my configuration file which is:

image: node:10.15.0

pipelines:\\
branches:\\
development:

* step:\\
name: Build\\
caches:
* node\\
script:
* cd Client
* yarn install
* yarn run build:prod
* yarn run package\\
artifacts:
* Client/_.zip
* step:\\
name: Deploy to Dev\\
script:
* pipe: atlassian/azure-web-apps-deploy:0.2.1\\
variables:\\
APP_ID: $APP_ID\\
PASSWORD: $PASSWORD\\
TENANT_ID: $TENANT_ID\\
RESOURCE_GROUP: $RESOURCE_GROUP\\
NAME: 'PlantedRecoveryApp'\\
ZIP_FILE: 'Client/sources.zip'\\
SLOT: 'Dev'\\

name: Build\\

* node\\
script:
* cd Client

* yarn run build:prod

deployment: test\\

ZIP_FILE: 'Client/sources.zip'\\

name: Build\\

script:
* cd Client

* yarn run build:prod
* yarn run package\\

* Client/_.zip
* step:\\

PASSWORD: $PASSWORD\\

RESOURCE_GROUP: $RESOURCE_GROUP\\
NAME: 'PlantedRecoveryApp'\\

* step:\\
name: Build\\

fields.description:
When I create an issue with special chars it looks oke:

!117749787-image.png|thumbnail!\\
But when I modify that issue to add more information (editing, not commenting), the special chars are replaced by HTML encoded chars:

!1270207002-image.png|thumbnail!\\
I’d expect that those chars aren’t changed when editing the issue.

The annoying thing is that, when you have a lot of text, like “I’d expect“ or “Doesn’t look good“ the text becomes unreadable due to all HTML-encoding.

Could you have a look into this and fix it?

I hope that I’m putting the issue on the correct location.

Thanks!

Kind regards,

Gerben
fields.summary: HTML Special chars are updated to Number codes after editing an existing issue in my repo

fields.description: Search only works for english characters, but not working for other languages.
fields.summary: Search commit message not working for non-latin messages

fields.description:
As of now, the user can only specify Docker service memory that applies to all the builds.\\
However, some scenario users would like to test their integration and would like to have different and larger docker service memory to proceed further.

It will best to provide the ability to create multiple definitions for docker service so that users can specify specific docker service memory for specific build.

Configuration Suggestion:

{code}
#!python

definitions:
  services:
    docker:
      memory: 3024
    docker-1:
      memory: 7128

pipelines:
  branches:
# Build with 4GB memory allocated
    master:
      - step:
          script:
            - echo "Hello"
          services:
            - docker

  custom:
# Build with 8GB memory allocated
    integration-tests:
      - step:
          size: 2x
          script:
            - echo "Tests completed"
          services:
            - docker-1
{code}
fields.summary: Allow users to configure memory for services on step level (e.g. docker)

fields.description:
h2. How to Replicate

h2. Expected Result

fields.description: I created a Jira account, with this same account I accessed to my Bitbucket account but my Administrator can’t see my user, so he can't give me permissions to specific repo, in fact when he checks the users to give permissions, I don’t appear in the list, he add my email ( already register ) and allow it but saying to create a new account, he tried to send me the email just for check the case, but i never received that email.
fields.summary: Administrator can't see my Account to assign me permissions in a repo.

fields.description:
I have few test environments, for instance:

* test1
* test2
* test3

I would like to have a possibility to deploy my application to only one of them. Let’s say I have a config:

{code}
  pull-requests:
    '**':
      - step: *build-app
      - step: *build-img
      - step:
          <<: *deploy
          name: Deploy to test1
          deployment: test1
          trigger: manual
      - step:
          <<: *deploy
          name: Deploy to test2
          deployment: test2
          trigger: manual
      - step:
          <<: *deploy
          name: Deploy to test3
          deployment: test3
          trigger: manual          
{code}

After pull request is created, I would like to have a possibility to choose test environment where application will be deployed. For instance I would like to deploy it to test2 only. Now it’s impossible. I have to deploy to test1 to be able to deploy to test2, then to test3.
fields.summary: Allow to manually deploy to only one of the group of environments

fields.description:
We have project with filenames containing brackets [ and ].

If we create a pull request containing changed/new files with [ or ] in its name Bitbucket is not able to show the changes. Instead of showing the file content/changes it shows an error message (see screenshot attached).

‌

The translated error is something like:\\
"An error occoured" - "During request handling an error occurs. Please reload."

‌

a HAR file and screenshot is attached

‌

may also see [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/24/SSP-33807|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/24/SSP-33807]

‌

we will reproduce the issue with debug enabled and provide a support zip

To enable debug logging:

# Click the Cog icon to access the Administration menu > Logging & Profiling > check *Enable debug logging*
# Reproduce the issue
# Click the Cog icon to access the Administration menu > Support Tools > Select "Create support zip" Tab > Uncheck "Limit file sizes" > Create
# Attach data to this ticket.
fields.summary: Pull request containing ] or [ in file name - error

fields.description:
As of now, non-admin can only view the Repository Variable while using Pipelines editor.\\
It will be best that users can also view Account Variables.\\
!3382791416-account-variable.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow non-admin to view read-only account variable in repository

fields.description:
[\\
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/event-payloads-740262817.html\\|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/event-payloads-740262817.html%5C]](https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/event-payloads-740262817.html)\\
commits: An array containing up to 5 of the most recent commits pushed to the reference. The array for a push with more than 5 commits is truncated, which is indicated by the truncated property.

This arbitrary limit, for which there is no workaround, is causing major trouble when trying to use this event to alert in Hipchat, Slack, Discord and other communication channels. This is especially critical when repos are private and event alerts are the only way to keep users informed about development progress.

This limit should be removed, allowing all events to be parsed.
fields.summary: Event Payload Commit Truncation
Error in translation to Russian

fields.description:
I have my personal fork of a project, and there is the 'main' repo, both of which are on bitbucket. I'm currently getting a 500 error when cloning one of them, and then pulling from the other. I have not seen this issue with this repository before - I have been happily pulling and pushing from multiple forks, and I don't believe anything has changed about my setup, though obviously the repositories have continued to change over time. Here is the example. I know there is not much detail, but you may be able to reproduce it with these two repositories (they are public).

{code:bash}
[bilbo:~]$ cd /tmp
[bilbo:tmp]$ hg clone https://bitbucket.org/labscript_suite/labscript_utils
destination directory: labscript_utils
requesting all changes
adding changesets
adding manifests
adding file changes
added 701 changesets with 744 changes to 96 files
new changesets 81b41521ad5e:783680f0d6f0
updating to branch default
58 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved
[bilbo:tmp]$ cd labscript_utils/
[bilbo:labscript_utils]$ hg pull https://bitbucket.org/cbillington/labscript_utils
pulling from https://bitbucket.org/cbillington/labscript_utils
searching for changes
abort: HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error
[bilbo:labscript_utils]$ hg --version
Mercurial Distributed SCM (version 5.0)
(see https://mercurial-scm.org for more information)

Copyright (C) 2005-2019 Matt Mackall and others
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions. There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
{code}

I am seeing this problem with mercurial 5.0 on Linux, but not with mercurial 4.9 on Windows. My Linux computer has been on mercurial 5.0 for 3 weeks, and I have been pulling and pushing from both these repos in that time.
fields.summary: 500: Internal Server Error when pulling from multiple mercurial forks

fields.description:
When pulling a Docker image in "Build setup" phase, there are no logs presented in the UI if there are errors/issues while pulling a Docker image.

*Feature Request:*\\
It would be best we could present pulling of Docker image logs in the "Build setup" phase if there are errors/issues when pulling a Docker image in Pipelines.

*Benefits:*\\
This way, customers with a custom Docker image can troubleshoot the issue by themselves faster.
fields.summary: Display logs for pulling docker image

fields.description:
After deleting a repository, it's no longer possible to define a redirect URL where we can lead users to head over to the new repository URL.

*Feature Request:*\\
It would be best if we can allow users to define a redirect URL after deleting a repository.
fields.summary: Defining a redirect URL after deleting a repository

fields.description:
When creating a branch by clicking the "Create branch" button on the sidebar of a Jira issue, the summary of the issue is passed in the issueSummary URL parameter and is used as the default name of the newly created branch. During processing of this URL parameter, any non-ASCII characters get removed from it, which sometimes results in unreadable branch names, especially in diacritics-heavy languages.

I suggest instead of removing these characters to try to convert them to their accentless ASCII alternatives (e.g. ó,ö,ő,õ… → o).
fields.summary: Use accented characters' ASCII versions in default branch names

fields.description: When I click on "View details" for "repo:push" event with status 400 on page "Webhooks" in my Bitbucket repo settings, I get empty page though should see request payload and other info according to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/troubleshoot-webhooks-757727842.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/troubleshoot-webhooks-757727842.html]
fields.summary: Empty webhook request details

fields.description:
*Issue*

When you have an unsaved comment and you accidentally (or consciously) change page, exit the tab or click to create to write a new comment, you will lose what you have written.

‌

This can be incredibly frustrating.

‌

*Proposed Solution - Store unsaved comments*

* Allow the user to have multiple comment boxes open. This functionality already exists for replies but hasn’t made its way to comments (see image). This will stop unsaved comments being deleted and make the user acknowledge they do in fact want to cancel their comment.
* Store the unsaved comment in the users local storage. If the user revisits the same page it should re-show the unsaved comments. They will then have the opportunity to finish writing or cancel the comment. This will resolve frustrations for when the user may not be able to save their comment for other reasons. For example I have had a browser crashing issue when writing some longer comments and lost what I was writing
* On PR merge or some other event it can clear the unsaved comments

‌

*Supplementary Solution - Prompt on exist*

Add a ‘You have an unsaved comment. Are you sure you want to leave?’ on navigation route change.

On tab exit, use the browser native exit confirm

‌

‌

*Multiple Replies - Only one comment*

!1393376366-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unsaved PR comments

fields.description:
Subject: Repository > Settings > Repository details > Change avatar

After the repository avatar has been uploaded and the "save" action has been executed, the new avatar will be saved. However, in the current view (Repository details) the user does not get any feedback that the repository avatar has been changed. The current repository avatar is not displayed. After loading the view (Repository details) again, the current  repository avatar is displayed.

The following could be improved

# a text feedback: "Repository avatar successfully updated"
# The new avatar is displayed immediately.
fields.summary: Provide feedback as soon as the image is changed
